intro: Physaria geyeri, commonly known as the Geyer's bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate and linear, while its flowers are small and clustered in racemes. Physaria geyeri is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
